Incident.Summary: DUI ACCIDENT E/B 50 AT Severn River Bridge

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: Incident was recorded on J-10 in-car camera and body worn camera. Incident Type DUI/Accident Case # 23-MSP-008920 Date of Incident: 03/10/2023 Location of Incident: Eastbound Route 50 at the Severn River Bridge Agency: Maryland State Police Defendant: Chavez Mujica, Luis Alberto Date of Birth: 09/30/1991 License Number: C-125-560-041-754 Time of Arrest: 0035 Hours Training and Awards: Trained in administering standardized field sobriety test through Maryland State Police. NHSTA certified to conduct field sobriety (SFST) margin-left:8px">Advanced Roadside Impaired Driving Enforcement (ARIDE) Call for service: On 03/10/2023 at approximately 2345 hours, I Tpr. Fuller #7354 was on duty, in uniform, operating marked MSP unit J-10. I was dispatched to a single vehicle collision in the area of Eastbound Route 50 at the Severn River Bridge. When I arrived on scene, I noticed a black Toyota Camry bearing Maryland registration 5BR6496 in lane four and overturned. While on scene I was advised that witnesses cut the driver out of the driver seat and pulled him out of the vehicle. These witnesses were identified by their Maryland Drivers Licenses, Jennifer Marie Bennett DOB: 06/13/1985 (Maryland License # B-530-398-585-443), Kristen Ashley Giles DOB: 03/05/1988 (Maryland License # G-420-478-072-169) and Angela Ann Dejong DOB: 08/20/1972 (Maryland License # D-252-067-067-650). The witnesses all stated they could smell a strong odor of alcohol emitting from the driver while they were attending to him. Personal Contact: I made contact with the driver and sole occupant of the vehicle. The driver was later identified through his foreign identification card as Chavez Mujica, Luis Alberto DOB: 09/30/1991 (Maryland ID #C-125-560-041-754). I asked Mr. Chavez if he had any form of identification he said somewhere in the car. When asked if he could give me his name. Mr. Chavez said Luis when asked for his middle name Mr. Chavez wrote his nickname Pachero and told me thats all I needed to know. Mr. Chavez was also stating Youre a Trooper right?. I answered yes and then Mr. Chavez would state ok then you should know. I also asked Mr. Chavez where he was coming from and going to. Mr. Chavez said from Annapolis and to his hotel. Mr. Chavez refused medical treatment twice while on scene. During my interaction with Mr. Chavez, I detected a strong odor of an alcoholic beverage emitting from his breath. I also noticed Mr. Chavez eyes to be bloodshot. Mr. Chavez was detained for suspicions of driving under the influence of alcohol and transported to the Maryland State Police Annapolis barrack to perform a standardized field sobriety test. Pre-Arrest Screening: Upon arrival at the Maryland State Police Annapolis Barrack. I asked Mr. Chavez multiple times if he would perform Standardized Field Sobriety. Mr. Chavez would respond with Im not a victim, Im not a victim nothing like that I can drink whatever I want to drink. When asked again if he would perform field sobriety Mr. Chavez mumbled Listen to melisten to me first youre not the one with power in this.power. When asked again to perform field sobriety. Mr. Chavez said youre not listeningstop putting your family in danger. Field Sobriety was not performed due to Mr. Chavez not giving a definitive answer. Horizontal Gaze Nystagmus: Refused Walk and Turn: Refused One Leg Stand: Refused PBT Test: Not Offered Arrest: 20-Minute Observation Period: During the 20-Minute observation period. Mr.Chavez would say and slur many things and those are listed below. Watch around you You know how many times I went to prison? my.cartel and their the ones with the power asylum from freaking cartel thing when you guys are one to put me in danger and stuff trying to make the right whatd I tell youcartel thingscartel thingand your familyI already spoke to the marshals you will believe power of cartel so im going to be locked up because im drunk right with a dui and all that stuff. I have to take some classes. Thats why I hate America because its about moneyits about money Mr. Chavez was then placed in a holding cell at the Annapolis Barrack. While in the holding cell, Mr Chavez unrolled some toilet paper, wet them up and threw them at the holding cell ceiling camera in an attempt to block the view. Chavez was unsuccessful in blocking the view after several attempts. A MVA and NCIC check of Mr. Chavez showed that he did not possess a valid drivers license in all 50 States and had an active warrant with the U.S Marshal Service for probation violation/illegal re-entry into the U.S. Intoximeter Results: DR-15 was read using the Audio MVA system in English and Mr. Chavez was given a copy to read along with. Mr. Chavez ripped up the copy I handed to him and refused the intoximeter. Charges: TA 21-902(b1i) Driving Veh. While Impaired By Alcohol TA 21-902(a1i) Driving Vehicle while Under The Influence Of Alcohol TA 21-201(a1) Driver Failure To Obey Properly Placed Traffic Control Device Instructions TA 21-901.1(a) Reckless Driving Vehicle In Wanton And Willful Disregard For Safety of Persons and Property TA 21-801(b) Failure To Control Vehicle Speed On Highway To Avoid Collision TA 16-112 Failure Of Individual Driving On Highway To Display License To Uniformed Police On Demand TA 101(a1) Driving, Attempting To Drive Motor Vehicle On Highway Without Required License And Authorization TA 21-901.1(b) Negligent Driving Vehicle In Careless And Imprudent Manner Endangering Property, Life and Person Discharge: Mr. Chavez was transported to Anne Arundel County Jennifer Road Detention Center and released to see a District Court Commissioner. All Events Occurred in Anne Arundel County, Maryland.
